content.title: Indirect Tax Internship Scheme In Central Board Of Indirect Taxes And Customs (CBIC)
content.details: The 'Indirect Tax Internship Scheme' by the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) takes 10 Law Students and 10 Law Graduates as Interns every year. The interns are expected to study case files, assist in legal research and drafting of petitions, brief the counsels and extend any other related legal/general assistance to officers/counsels. The interns may also accompany the departmental officers to the briefing meetings if needed. This is a full-time internship and is to be attended physically and the interns are not expected to pursue any other course/work during the tenure of the internship.
benefits: Stipend of ₹ 5,000/- per month for student interns
Stipend of ₹ 15,000/- per month for graduate interns
Certificate of Internship upon satisfactory completion
eligibility: Law students pursuing a 3-year LLB course/5-year integrated LLB course
Law graduates who have completed a 3-year LLB course/5-year integrated LLB course for not more than two years
Students who have appeared in the final year/semester examination on the cutoff date
exclusions: Selected candidates who failed to join on the date of joining may be debarred for a period of six months
content.application_process: The duly filled and self-attested application in the prescribed format, along with the required document should be sent by email to dlasmc-cbic@gov.in.
documents_required: Proof of Educational Qualification (i.e. result sheet/mark sheet/provisional degree etc.)

faqs.question: How Many Law Students Are Selected Every Year For The Internship?
faqs.answer: 10 Law Students and 10 Law Graduates are selected as Interns every year.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Daily Routine Of The Interns?
faqs.answer: The interns are expected to study case files, assist in legal research and drafting of petitions, brief the counsels and extend any other related legal/general assistance to officers/counsels.

faqs.question: Where Will The Interns Be Deployed For The Course Of The Internship?
faqs.answer: The interns will be deployed in different sections of the legal establishment in CBIC.

faqs.question: What Is The Full Name Of CBIC?
faqs.answer: The full name of CBIC is 'Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs'.

faqs.question: Are The Interns Allowed To Take Any Other Internship/Job During The Course Of This Internship?
faqs.answer: The interns are not expected to pursue any other course/work during the tenure of the internship.

faqs.question: Is This Internship Virtual Or In-Office?
faqs.answer: This is a full-time internship and is to be attended physically.

faqs.question: Does This Internship Has Prospects Of A Permanent Job With CBIC?
faqs.answer: The internship will neither be a job nor an assurance of a job in the Department.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Duration Of The Internship For Law Students? Is The Duration Extendable?
faqs.answer: For Law Students, the period of internship shall be two months extendable upto a maximum total period of three months by the Principal Commissioner, Directorate of Legal Affairs on mutual agreement.

faqs.question: Who Is Authorized To Extend The Duration Of The Internship?
faqs.answer: The Principal Commissioner, Directorate of Legal Affairs is authorized to extend the duration of the internship.

faqs.question: How Many Leaves Can An Intern Take In A Month?
faqs.answer: The maximum permissible leave of absence is 2 days per month.
